content:
ENTITY_DELETE - Developer
Skip to content
ENTITY_DELETE
event type
Â¶
ENTITY_DELETE
events are emitted whenever an
asset
is deleted in Atlan. This includes:
Soft deletion, or archival of an asset.
Hard deletion, or purging of an asset.
One
ENTITY_DELETE
event is emitted for each asset that is deleted
So, for example, if you run the connection delete utility to remove a connection with:
3 databases
10 schemas
500 tables
15,000 columns
Atlan will emit 15,514
ENTITY_DELETE
events â€” one for each of these assets (and the connection itself).
The details of the deleted asset will be in the
message.entity
portion of the event payload. The
message.entity.deleteHandler
will indicate the kind of delete:
DEFAULT
is an archival
HARD
is a purge
Example ENTITY_DELETE event
